intro: Mosquitoxylum jamaicense var. panamense, commonly known as the Panamanian mosquito plant, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found near water sources. Its common name reflects its historical use in traditional medicine for repelling mosquitoes.
